title: THDC India aims to make Rs 12,000-crore coal-based thermal power project operational by September
description: State-owned THDC India Ltd is targeting to have its coal-based power plant up and running by September 2024, signaling its foray into the domestic thermal energy sector, as per a senior company official. The company is in the process of establishing a 1,320 megawatt (2X660 MW) Super Thermal Power Project (STPP) in Bulandshahr district, Uttar Pradesh. Currently, THDC India Ltd has a total installed power generation capacity of approximately 1,587 MW, comprising 1,424 MW from hydro sources, 113 MW from wind, and 50 MW from solar energy.
